article.headline: Drexel 78, George Mason 66
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Jeremiah King led five players in double figures with a game-high 19 points as Drexel beat George Mason 78-66 on Wednesday night. The Dragons (15-10, 10-6 Colonial Athletic Association) took control with a 13-2 run that started at the end of the first half and carried over into the second. King hit a 3-pointer with 1:43 remaining in the first half to start the run and capped it off by scoring the first five points of the second half to give the Dragons their biggest lead of the game, 41-28, with 19:14 remaining. Phil Goss added 17 points, Bashir Mason had 12 points and 10 assists, Sean Brooks added 11 points and Kennell Sanchez contributed 10, while Chaz Crawford pulled down a game-high 13 rebounds and blocked three shots. Tony Skinn had 17 points to lead the Patriots (16-11, 10-7), who closed the gap to seven points on a 3-pointer by Lamar Butler with 1:32 remaining in the game. Jai Lewis scored 14 points and Lamar Butler had 13.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
